c:complexType.name: NumberFormatStyle
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation of the number format style class.
The options in this class are mostly useful for customizing locale sensitive styles of number formatting.
See for more information on inheritance of formatting configurations.

c:property.name: decimal
c:property.c:documentation: The character to use in place of the "." mask character. The decimal point separates the integer and fraction parts of the number.

c:property.name: group
c:property.c:documentation: The character to use in place of the "," mask character. The group separator groups integer digits according to the sizes in groupSizes. Grouping can be disabled, independently of the mask, by specifying "".

c:property.name: groupSizes
c:property.c:documentation: The array of group sizes. The last group is repeated indefinitely. The array must contain at least one element.

c:property.name: negativeSign
c:property.c:documentation: The negative sign character. The negative sign is used to indicate a negative number when a mask does not have a negative values section. The negative sign is placed leftmost in the resulting string. The negative sign is also used for showing a negative exponent, in scientific notation.

c:property.name: currency
integerPad
c:property.c:documentation: The character to use in place of a "0" mask character in the integer part.

c:property.name: fractionPad
c:property.c:documentation: The character to use in place of a "0" mask character in the fractional part.

c:property.name: abbreviations
c:property.c:documentation: The array of abbreviations. There is no maximum number of units abbreviations. The first element of the array represents the Thousands unit, the second Millions, the third Billions...
